newsitem.title: CROATIA: Craoatian lending rate flat in balanced trade.
newsitem.headline: Craoatian lending rate flat in balanced trade.

text.p: The Croatian average lending rate was flat at 11.7 percent on Friday in lively but balanced trade, dealers said.
They put total settlements at 64.5 million kuna, more than double Thursday's trade. A 5-million kuna surplus was left on the supply side at day's end.
Fresh borrowings accounted for 46.5 million kuna, mostly granted at steady call money rates of 10.5 and 11 percent. Some smaller term loans were made at 15 and 16 percent.
Insurers rolled over old money at a steady 9 percent, and banks extended previous loans at rates varying from 12 to 16 percent.
The central bank calculated its kuna midrates for Saturday and Monday firmer at 6.0425 against the dollar and at 3.5732 against the German mark.
